Jackson's is a stylish, spacious and very cool space in which to spend time in downtown Rockford. It's located on an eclectic downtown block on E. The space itself is a large loft apartment, easily accessible with keypad door entry to a staircase that takes you directly up to the apartment (no corridors or lobbys to negotiate, very handy). Inside it's a large open plan living room and kitchen, with tasteful decor and some great (and varied!) artwork hanging on the walls.
A sliding door leads to a cosy and decent-sized bedroom with a closet and dressing table space behind. The main bathroom is a joy to behold with a large and modern walk-in shower with multiple shower heads and a digital temperature control. There is also an enclosed deck area which is a great place to chill out in the evenings.
The living room has plenty of comfortable seating and a large Roku-equipped TV. There's also a similar TV in the bedroom and a space heater if you get cold. The main temperature control is a digital system and was easily controlled.
The kitchen has a basic set of utensils and cutlery, enough to making cooking at home a possibility should you want to. There is short-term on-street parking right outside and a lot in the back as well.
Paul is fantastic at communicating to explain the check-in process and other info about the apartment. He was also very responsive to any queries we had during our stay. A nice little touch is that he offers a discount on the bill if you eat downstairs at Abreo - again, we highly recommend that you try it out!
Final recommendation - if you're in town when the nearby West Side Show Room has a show on, we urge you to check it out - they stage bold, brave and highly laudable productions and are a credit to Rockford. Go check them out at wssr.org
